publication.abstract: Existing linkage-analysis methods address binary or quantitative traits. However, many complex diseases and human conditions, particularly behavioral disorders, are rated on ordinal scales. Herein, we introduce, LOT, a tool that performs linkage analysis of ordinal traits for pedigree data. It implements a latent-variable proportional-odds logistic model that relates inheritance patterns to the distribution of the ordinal trait. The likelihood-ratio test is used for testing evidence of linkage. Â© The Author 2008. Published by Oxford University Press. All rights reserved.
publication.title: LOT: A tool for linkage analysis of ordinal traits for pedigree data

summary.description: LOT (Linkage analysis of Ordinal Traits) is a software program that performs linkage analysis of ordinal traits for pedigree data. It implements a latent-variable proportional-odds logistic model that relates inheritance patterns to the distribution of the ordinal trait.
